response_parsed.title: Designing Microservices Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides an overview of designing microservices using the FastAPI framework in Python 3.12+. It covers key points, code examples, version notes, and caveats to help you understand and implement this architecture.
key_points: FastAPI is a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+
It supports asynchronous operations, automatic JSON serialization/deserialization, and more
Microservices architecture allows breaking down large applications into smaller, independently deployable services
FastAPI enables the creation of microservices using a simple, easy-to-learn syntax

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for using FastAPI
FastAPI version 0.65.0 was used during the writing of this guide
caveats: FastAPI does not support Python versions below 3.7
Ensure your development and deployment environments meet FastAPI's dependencies for seamless operation
